headline: Computer Science, Economics, and Data Science
about: Hi! I'm a software engineer with key experience in site reliability, technology consulting, machine learning, and data science. I graduated Vanderbilt University cum laude with degrees in computer science and economics, combining technical depth with analytical problem-solving. Beyond my professional work, I'm an avid snowboarder, a casual tennis player, and a sci-fi geek.

cards.title: Software Engineer, GEICO Tech
cards.description: Developed and maintained a suite of internal tools for GEICO's Site Reliability Engineering teams. Led the transition of data off of a third-party data monitoring tool for hundreds of applications, numerous systems, and thousands of developers, leading to millions of dollars in annual budget savings. Developed a tool to aggregate service-level indicators and objectives at both the system-level and at the VP-level. Collaborated with cross-functional teams to integrate new tools into existing workflows and improve team efficiency.

cards.title: Vanderbilt University
cards.description:
Cum laude, Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Bachelor of Arts in Economics.
Minor in Data Science.
GPA: 3.9/4.0

cards.title: VandyHacks Design Board
cards.description: Led the website design for Vanderbilt University's ninth annual collegiate hackathon, designed VandyHack's cross-year mobile website, coordinated on-site installations, and developed digital assets for VandyHack's tenth hackathon. Collaborated with the marketing board and outside student groups to consistently attract hundreds more participants to each annual hackathon.

cards.title: Tech Associate, Accenture
cards.description: Led the end-to-end development of an internal website showcasing Operations Studio services and products, increasing client acquisition and interaction. Developed interactive visual assets for key client-facing presentations, enhancing proposal engagement and securing multiple long-term business partnerships.

cards.title: ScuffedFish: A Minimax & Alpha-Beta Pruning Chess AI
cards.description: Implemented a custom JavaScript chess engine using minimax and alpha-beta pruning AI techniques. Evaluated the performance of different utility functions in an analytical report. Determined that the addition of positional utility increases engine performance as well as the occurrence of standard, player-like chess openings.

cards.title: Explaining Species Endangerment Through Network Analysis
cards.description: Examined the correlations between species endangerment levels and various network metrics using large-scale datasets from the IUCN RedList API and studies of the Greater Antillean coral reef. Case study uses network analysis to highlight the greater endangerment level of species with high node distance from producer species.

cards.title: Software Engineer Intern, Amador Bioscience
cards.description: Led a three-intern team for the full stack development of an analysis tool using R Shiny and C++. Automated the production of non-compartmental analysis tables, listings, and figures. Implemented a web application to enable analysis customization via a simple user workflow. Established unit tests and documentation structures for future development.

cards.title: Bird Microsite!
cards.description: A neat little personal project. Experimented with JavaScript to create a fun little website.

cards.title: Digital Systems Teaching Assistant, Vanderbilt University
cards.description: Tutored 33 students in logic, organization, and assembly language programming. Facilitated the transition to an online question-and-answer platform for students to anonymously seek coursework help. Assisted professor in grading homework and exams. Standardized scoring and refined answer keys for future use.

cards.title: Machine Learning Research Intern, Amador Bioscience
cards.description: Used R and various machine learning methods to model the relationship between drug efficacy and subject data. Reported results to an executive-level audience. Guided future research objectives by identifying key features that impact drug efficacy.

cards.title: Vanderbilt Robotics
cards.description: Assisted the implementation of robot vision for the Vanderbilt Robotics Camera Sub-team and worked on Vanderbilt's robot entry to the NASA Lunabotics Competition.

cards.title: An Insight into China's Investments in Kenya, Yale Young Global Scholars
cards.description: Conducted and presented a case study on China-Kenya relations and the influence of foreign aid on state sovereignty. Highlighted the expanding economic influence of China upon third-world countries and its cultural, political, and long-term impact.

cards.title: What's Your Beef: The Effect of Visual Representation on Framing, SQRI
cards.description: Conducted during the Carleton College Summer Quantitative Reasoning Institute. Led a student behavioral economics team to analyze psychological framing from product packaging. Conducted an Amazon MTurk experiment on consumer ratings and a 2-by-3 analysis of variance.
